articles.description: Follow live text updates from the Europa League & Europa Conference League last 16 second legs.
articles.title: Liverpool, Brighton, West Ham, Aston Villa & Rangers in European action

articles.description: Rangers' Europa League campaign crashes to an end after Rafa Silva's breakaway goal proves decisive to send Benfica into the quarter-finals after another thrilling encounter at Ibrox.
articles.title: Rangers out of Europe after defeat by Benfica

articles.description: Banned Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva was given 56 medications, nutritional and dietary supplements, the Court of Arbitration for Sport reveals.
articles.title: Kamila Valieva: Russian figure skater given 56 medications and supplements over two years

articles.description: Two horses part-owned by Manchester United boss Sir Alex Ferguson win at the Cheltenham Festival before Harry Redknapp enjoys a victory too.
articles.title: Cheltenham Festival: Sir Alex Ferguson and Harry Redknapp celebrate winners

articles.description: Liverpool thrash Sparta Prague at Anfield to complete a resounding aggregate victory as they move into the quarter-finals of the Europa League.
articles.title: Liverpool thrash Sparta to reach last eight

articles.description: Anthony Gordon and Jarrad Branthwaite receive their first England call-ups for the friendlies against Brazil and Belgium this month.
articles.title: Gordon and Branthwaite get first England call-ups

articles.description: Aston Villa defeat Ajax at a raucous Villa Park to move into the Europa Conference League quarter-finals.
articles.title: Aston Villa thrash Ajax to move into quarter-finals

articles.description: West Ham record the biggest European win in their history as they sweep Freiburg aside to overturn a first-leg deficit and march into a third successive quarter-final.
articles.title: West Ham thrash Freiburg to reach quarter-finals

articles.description: Ireland head coach Andy Farrell names an unchanged team for Saturday's title-deciding Six Nations match against Scotland in Dublin.
articles.title: Farrell names unchanged Ireland team for Scotland

articles.description: Australian Open champion Jannik Sinner extends winning run to 19 matches with comfortable win over Jiri Lehecka to reach the semi-finals at Indian Wells.
articles.title: Indian Wells: Jannik Sinner extends winning run to reach semi-final
